definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

definition: variant of 閻羅|阎罗[Yan2 luo2]/Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja

sentences.english: Yan felt that the first step should be a 'national rejuvenation' policy.
sentences.chinese: 阎的观点是中国第一步应该采取“民族复兴”政策。

sentences.english: Yan Hello, there is such a problem would like to begin your interview.
sentences.chinese: 阎先生您好，有这样的问题，首先要你的采访。

sentences.english: Yan Zhen's novels focus on the spiritual plight of intellectuals.
sentences.chinese: 阎真的小说专注于对知识分子精神困境的刻画。

definition: first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
high mountain/highest peak of a mountain ridge
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
